pr_title: Fixes #3479: Implement Progress Bar for Zoom Activity

timeline.message: ZoomableActivity: add hierarchy to view for displaying progress bar
CircularProgressBar: circular progress bar for ZoomableDraweeView

timeline.bodyText: Sometimes intermediate image is also slowly appears. I think we should also use the progressbar for that phase. What do you think @kbhardwaj123 ?
timeline.author: neslihanturan

replies.bodyText: @neslihanturan actually i inspected this thing and found that if i place a log statement for onIntermediateImageSet it won't appear in the logs, i think it would be better if i make the Indeterminate spinner INVISIBLE as soon as Intermediate image is set
replies.author: kbhardwaj123

timeline.bodyText: Why we are using a custom ProgressBar drawable, is this necessary?
timeline.author: neslihanturan

replies.bodyText:
The Fresco API demands it and the drawable they use in their sample is maybe the one used here, seeing as it has the same error, link
I'd prefer to not use it and just have the indeterminate
replies.author: macgills

replies.bodyText:
@neslihanturan i just realised that SimpleDraweeView in the Contributions home page while uploading shows linear progress bar so i think it would be more appropriate to keep linear one for UI consistency, i will change it
@macgills i have added the progressbar because if the image size is heavy then it might take some time to load as @neslihanturan elucidated in the issue thread, i will replace circular progressbar with linear one while keeping the indeterminate spinner
replies.author: kbhardwaj123

replies.bodyText: It seems really confusing as a user that my image is loading twice. I don't mind if the bar is linear or circular but there should only be one loading indication
replies.author: macgills

replies.bodyText:
@macgills i completely agree with you but the problem is that the

In-deterministic spinner would not account for the downloading of a big image file
Keeping only progressBar will show a show black screen for 95% of the time as you correctly pointed out previously

I think the best middle ground is to keep a linear progress bar which is much less intrusive and would fulfill the purpose of showing download progress,
What do you think about this :)
replies.author: kbhardwaj123

replies.bodyText:
By default show the indeterminate spinner, surely there is some callback imageLoadComplete where you can just hide it, the place that currently hides the progressdrawable.
I don't know fresco well, I'd use picasso or maybe coil nowadays
replies.author: macgills

replies.bodyText: Yeah just stop setting it Gone in onIntermediateImageSet
replies.author: macgills

replies.bodyText:
This is how it looks with the changes:
The blue bar at the bottom is the progress bar
replies.author: kbhardwaj123

replies.bodyText:
That works, just frustrating this scenario doesn't have better support in fresco.
Maybe if we had a good placeholderImage it would feel less weird to me?
replies.author: macgills

replies.bodyText:
I'll leave final say with @neslihanturan
I still think only using the ProgressBar makes for a better visual experience
replies.author: macgills

timeline.message: remove circular progressbar and make changes to controller listener
